business.headline: NPS Vatsalya: 9,705 minors sign up on Day 1. Here's how to invest for your child?The scheme, overseen by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), is part of the National Pension System (NPS) and aims to help parents and guardians begin retirement savings for their children from an early age

PM Modi scans Paytm QR at Vishwakarma exhibition, highlights fintech's role for small merchantsPM Modi bought an artefact of Bhagwan Jagannath and paid via Paytm QR, showcasing not only the significance of the crafts but also the role of fintech in empowering small merchants and fostering increased trust in mobile payments.

Study shows people in US work 5 days to buy iPhone 16; how long do Indians need?A recent study reveals how long people in different countries need to work in order to afford the iPhone 16, with citizens in Switzerland requiring the least number of days.
No work, no pay: Samsung warns workers on strike in Chennai The strike, which began on September 9, 2024, involves hundreds of workers at Samsung's home appliances factory near Chennai.

Sensex ends 1,400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; ICICI Bank jumps 5%At the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,381.99 points to 84,566.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 375.15 points to settle at 25,790.95.
Ashneer Grover shares why he quit EY in a day despite Rs 1 crore salaryIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Should you buy Vodafone Idea shares after 20% fall? UBS shares new target priceVodafone Idea shares fell 20% after the Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed the company's curative petition, which sought a re-computation of Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues.
Explained: Why IIFL Finance shares surged 13% todayIIFL Finance stock climbed to a high of Rs 560.60, marking its peak since late February, before settling to trade 9.31% higher as of 2:06 pm.
Explained: Why Cochin Shipyard shares soared 10% todayAt around 12:25 pm, shares of the company were up 9.45% at Rs 1,837.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

RITES shares rise 8% but why railway PSU stock may be showing 48% slideDespite this positive momentum, many investors were caught off guard, seeing what appeared to be a 48% slide in the stock price on their trading apps.
Elliott Hill's 32-year journey at Nike from intern to CEO goes viralElliott Hill, who has spent over 32 years at Nike, started his journey as an intern and will now be leading the iconic company.
Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty gains momentum; JSW Steel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 415.45 points at 83,600.25 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.80 points to trade at 25,550.90.

Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Tirupati laddoos were distributed during Ram temple event, says chief priestRam Temple chief priest Acharya Satyendra Das has said that laddoos from Tirupati temple were distributed as prasadam during the pran prathistha January ceremony.

PM's 3-day US visit begins today, to participate in Biden-hosted QuadThe fourth Quad Leaders' Summit will be hosted by President Joe Biden in his hometown of Wilmington in Delaware. The next Quad Summit will be hosted by India.

Fixed calendar for workplaces: Shashi Tharoor speaks to EY worker's fatherShashi Tharoor said he would propose legislation in Parliament for a fixed calendar to regulate working hours across all workplaces.

Kourtney Kardashian has a 'natural Ozempic' for weight loss. Is it a scam?Ozempic is a medication for Type 2 diabetes that helps control blood sugar, with the added side effect of weight loss. Socialite and reality TV personality Kourtney Kardashian has a natural alternative to Ozempic that she is going gaga over. What do doctors have to say?

Audiences have had enough, action movies need an intervalAction and violent films have been on the rise in Indian cinema in the last couple of years. However, not many action films have seen box office success in 2024. Is there an action-film fatigue among the audience?

Why Kerala-born businessman's name has come up in Hezbollah pager blasts?As the focus shifts to companies linked to the exploding pagers being used by Hezbollah members, the name of a Kerala-born businessman, Rinson Jose, and his Bulgaria-based company Norta Global cropped up. They have been given a clean chit by Bulgarian authorities. However, the entire saga points to a complex web of companies.

Rishabh Pant equals MS Dhoni's record with 6th Test hundredIndia vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Rishabh Pant celebrated his Test comeback with his sixth Test hundred in the second innings of the first Test. Pant equaled MS Dhoni's record of most Test hundreds by an Indian wicketkeeper.

Globetrotting career, PhD in Physics: Woman linked to Lebanon pager blastsAfter her company was revealed to have licensed the design for the pagers from their original Taiwanese manufacturer Gold Apollo, Cristiana Barsony-Arcidiacono said that she didn't make them.

Indian embassy official found dead under mysterious circumstances in USIn a statement, the Indian Embassy said that an official died on September 18 and his family members had been informed to ensure swift transfer of the body to India.

Actor Parvin Dabas in ICU after road accident. DetailsBollywood actor Parvin Dabas met with a car accident early Saturday, September 21, and is currently in the ICU. His wife, Preity Jhangiani, is by his side. Details of the incident are still emerging.

Tirupati laddoo row: Tender document raises questions on ghee selection processTirupati laddoo row: The tender mandates the supplier to submit a clearance certificate for each consignment of ghee from a FSSAI approved laboratory.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks Sunil Gavaskar's 51-year-old Test record India vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal has now scored the most runs by an Indian batter after 10 Test matches, breaking the record previously held by the legendary Sunil Gavaskar. Jaiswal has scored 1,094 runs compared to Gavaskar's 978.

Atishi to take oath as Delhi's youngest Chief Minister today with 5 ministers Atishi is set to become the third woman Chief Minister of Delhi, taking over from Arvind Kejriwal after the AAP chief stepped down from the post in a surprising move.

Cancer Moonshot on agenda during PM Modi's US visit: What is it?Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the annual Quad summit with leaders from Australia, Japan and the United States in Delaware, US to discuss various global issues including Joe Biden's Cancer Moonshot Initiative.

Sana Khan wonders what is wrong with men who 'allow' wives to wear skimpy clothesSana Khan expressed disbelief at men who 'allow' their wives to wear skimpy clothes, claiming every man wants their wives to dress modestly.

Tiny blue dot: You can see Neptune from India tonightFor observers in India, Neptune will be visible throughout most of the night on September 20-21, rising in the east just as the sun sets in the west.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Rare polar bear shows up outside woman's house in Iceland, cops shoot it deadThe bear was killed Thursday afternoon in the northwest of Iceland after police consulted the Environment Agency, which declined to have the animal relocated, police told Associated Press.

Amul denies supplying ghee to Tirupati temple amid 'animal fat in laddoo' rowIn a statement, Amul said that it prepares its ghee (clarified butter) from "high-quality pure milk fat" at its production facilities, adding that it never supplied ghee to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam (TTD).

SRK-Preity Zinta's Veer Zaara enters Rs 100 crore club after re-releaseYash Chopra's timeless classic Veer-Zaara surpassed Rs 100 crore-mark at the worldwide box office upon its re-release, proving that it is just as loved by fans even 20 years later.

BJP Mayor fakes blood donation during drive on PM's birthday, gets trolledBJP Mayor Vinod Agarwal said he went to the camp to donate blood but the doctor, when told that he was diabetic, said that he could not donate.
Pune tanker flips, gets swallowed by caved-in road in Pune, video is viralThe truck was at the location for drainage cleaning work when a part of the ground gave way.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs on suicide watch. Rep says he is strong and healthySean 'Diddy' Combs is currently under suicide watch in jail, a procedural step for high-profile individuals. His spokesperson confirmed that he is strong and healthy.

Rannvijay Singha returns as MTV Roadies Season 20 hostMTV Roadies is set to launch its 20th season, with the original host, Rannvijay Singha, returning at the helm. The makers recently released a new promo to announce the start of auditions for the reality show.

Director Payal Kapadia on All We Imagine As Light's Oscar hopePayal Kapadia's film 'All We Imagine As Light' won the Grand Prix award at Cannes and has now been submitted for review to be India's official entry into the Oscars.

Vettaiyan: Rajinikanth recalls Big B's ties with Gandhi family and his strugglesIn his emotional speech dedicated to Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth talked about the financial struggles of the megastar and how he bounced back. He also mentioned Big B's relationship with the Gandhi family and highlighted that he never took advantage of his personal connections in the industry.

GOAT box office Day 16: Vijay's film to cross Rs 250 crore nett in 3rd weekendThe Greatest of All Time saw a steep drop in its collection this week. However, with the weekend ahead, the Thalapathy Vijay-starrer is expected to reach the benchmark of Rs 250 crore nett at the domestic box office.

Rishabh Pant's audacious six off Hasan Mahmud leaves Virat Kohli stunnedVirat Kohli was left stunned as Rishabh Pant pulled off an audacious six off Hasan Mahumd on Day 3 of the Chennai Test. Pant was back to his vintage best as India piled on the misery on Bangladesh.

Shakib achieved this milestone during Bangladesh's first Test against India in Chennai.

Gurbaz, Rashid Khan power Afghanistan to historic ODI series winAFG vs SA: Rahmanullah Gurbaz's century and Rashid Khan's five-wicket haul helped Afghanistan claim the ODI series with a 177-run win on Friday in Sharjah.

Guardiola reveals injured De Bruyne could be part of City vs ArsenalManchester City manager Pep Guardiola hinted at a possible return for star midfielder Kevin De Bruyne ahead of their crucial clash against Arsenal, providing a much-needed boost as City face one of their toughest Premier League rivals.

Pep Guardiola has changed world football: Wright-Phillips on City BossFormer Manchester City winger Shaun Wright-Phillips believes that the sides' present manager Pep Guardiola, has not only changed the system and the nature of football in the side or the Premier League, but also in the world aspect. Wright-Phillips believes that Guardiola's contribution to football has been truly phenomenal.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
